intro: Triumfetta trigona, commonly known as the narrowleaf triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three leaflets. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing along roadsides and in disturbed soils. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
